title: Bed Bath & Beyond Stock Is Rising After Analyst Sees Potential for Asset Sales
text:
Text size

Uncredited

Bed Bath & Beyond stock (BBBY) is rising on Monday, thanks to an upgrade from Wedbush, which thinks the shares are attractive for deep value investors.

The back story. Bed Bath & Beyond has struggled to find its footing, falling more than 7% year to date, a period that has seen the SPDR S&P Retail ETF (XRT) make small gains and the S&P 500 rise 18%. The shares have been underperforming for some time, leading investors to cheer involvement by activist investors in April. Yet those hoping for big moves have been disappointed thus far, and the stock has reflected that. The company’s most recent earnings report, in July, also led to a selloff.
description: Wedbush analyst says he is encouraged by a board shake-up, improving corporate governance, and trimmed costs at Bed Bath & Beyond. Noncore asset sales and a new CEO could be catalysts for the shares, he says.
